support_summary: ATXN3 interacts specifically with LC3C, a key autophagy protein, during the early stages of the autophagic pathway.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 directly interacts with MAP1LC3C (LC3C), a member of the ATG8 family, during the early stages of autophagy.
functions.effect_description: This transient regulatory interaction supports the progression of the autophagic pathway.
biological_consequence: ATXN3-LC3C interaction → Facilitation of autophagosome formation → Clearance of cellular components
specific_effects: The interaction occurs via two regions within the Josephin domain of ATXN3.

evidence.paper_title: ATXN3: a multifunctional protein involved in the polyglutamine disease spinocerebellar ataxia type 3

mechanism: ATXN3 directly interacts with MAP1LC3C (LC3C), a member of the ATG8 family, during the early stages of autophagy.
effect: This transient regulatory interaction supports the progression of the autophagic pathway.
summary: ATXN3 activates MAP1LC3C to modulate autophagy, ultimately affecting clearance of cellular components.
